text:
I have seen an approach for setting Absolute image urls, that you just insert a module.text_field into the src, and just specify a default url in the text field itself.

Or you could expand it with a boolean if user wants to set an absolute url or choose an image from the file manager. I guess it's still ugly because you still see those default image controls in the image dropdown, and it can be misleading for the user.

I use get_asset_url() to point to images in the theme files.

`"default": {`
  `"src": "{{ get_asset_url('../../assets/images/file-name.png') }}"`
`}`

<@U03MU3H35R6> This is what I do for clients when I’m going to be doing the install and implementation, but I was thinking about how to make it more portable.

<@U39DT5YFL> Thank you for this! This is what I’ve done for individual instances of modules, but I didn’t realize that it was valid to call HubL filters in your fields.json! It makes sense now that I think about it, but for some reason, I had just assumed that HubL in json files wouldn’t be processed.
